abstract: Geologists have identified deposits of natural gas along a 150-mile-long trench where the state's coastal plain meets the Piedmont.
snippet: Geologists have identified deposits of natural gas along a 150-mile-long trench where the state's coastal plain meets the Piedmont.
lead_paragraph: The debate over horizontal hydraulic fracturing spreads to North Carolina, where geologists have identified deposits of natural gas along a 150-mile trench where the state's coastal plain meets the Piedmont. [Associated Press]

headline.main: On Our Radar: A New Fracking Frontier
